metadata.name: Conversation Example Sentences Export
metadata.description: All Japanese-English example sentences produced in this conversation, normalized into learner chunk format.

sentences.ja: 子どもは鬼をこわがっています。
grammarNotes: Vている here expresses a continuing state (being afraid), not an ongoing action.

sentences.en: Tarō is the eldest son in the family.

chunks.gloss: is the eldest son of the family

sentences.ja: 昔話には鬼がよく出てきます。
sentences.en: Demons often appear in old folk tales.
grammarNotes: Vてくる often indicates something appearing/coming into existence from a narrative perspective.

sentences.ja: 太郎は元気な子どもです。
びっくりして目玉が大きくなった。
grammarNotes: Vて links cause/reason to the following clause (because I was surprised...).
Vくなる expresses a change of state.

sentences.ja: うちの親父は料理が好きです。
notes: 親父 is colloquial and masculine; tone depends on context.

sentences.en: He is the eldest son in the family.

chunks.gloss: is the eldest son of the family

sentences.ja: 長男なので、家をつぐ予定です。
sentences.en: Because he is the eldest son, he plans to inherit the family.
grammarNotes: なので gives a softer explanatory reason than だから.

sentences.ja: 長男は東京で働いています。
sentences.en: The eldest son works in Tokyo.
grammarNotes: Vている indicates a continuing state (employment).

sentences.ja: 河の近くで遊ばないでください。
sentences.en: Please don't play near the river.
grammarNotes: Vないでください is a polite request not to do something.

sentences.ja: 昔の童の話を読みました。
sentences.en: I read an old story about children.

sentences.ja: 河童は川に住むと言われています。
sentences.en: Kappa are said to live in rivers.
grammarNotes: と言われている expresses hearsay or commonly accepted belief.

sentences.ja: 子どもに川へ近づかないように、河童の話をしました。
sentences.en: We told kappa stories so children wouldn’t go near the river.
grammarNotes: Vないように expresses purpose/prevention ('so that not').

chunks.ja: 子どもに川へ近づかないように
chunks.gloss: so that children do not go near the river

sentences.ja: 昔から河童の伝説が日本にあります。
sentences.en: Kappa legends have existed in Japan since long ago.
grammarNotes: 昔から indicates continuation from the past until now.

chunks.ja: 河童の伝説が日本にあります

sentences.en: I saw a fox in the forest.

sentences.ja: 妖狐は人に化けると言われています。
sentences.en: Fox spirits are said to transform into humans.
grammarNotes: Vると言われている indicates commonly reported belief.

chunks.gloss: that fox spirits transform into people

sentences.ja: 昔の話には狐の霊がよく出てきます。
sentences.en: Fox spirits often appear in old stories.

sentences.ja: 村の人は狐の霊を信じていました。
sentences.en: The villagers believed in fox spirits.
grammarNotes: Vていた marks a past continuing state.

chunks.ja: 狐の霊を信じていました

sentences.ja: 狐の霊が人に化けるという伝説があります。
sentences.en: There is a legend that fox spirits transform into humans.
grammarNotes: という + noun labels or defines content ('the legend that...').

chunks.ja: 狐の霊が人に化けるという
chunks.gloss: that fox spirits transform into people
